alert.note: Alert for Floyd (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 08 at 6:44PM EDT by NWS Louisville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Floyd and west central Jefferson Counties through 715 PM EDT... At 644 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Shively, moving southeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Louisville around 650 PM EDT. Parkway Village and Valley Station around 655 PM EDT. Audubon Park around 700 PM EDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Watterson Park, Lynnview, Seneca Gardens, Strathmoor Village, Kingsley, Strathmoor Manor, Newburg, Fairdale, St. Regis Park, West Buechel, Meadowview Estates, Poplar Hills, Lincolnshire, Okolona, Buechel, Houston Acres and Cambridge. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
